meanings.definition: The arrangement of events or dates in the order of their occurrence.
meanings.sent1: Studying the chronologies of ancient civilizations helps us understand their history.
meanings.sent2: Historians rely on chronologies to accurately depict the timeline of past events.
meanings.sent3: The chronologies of my daily routine are quite predictable and boring.
meanings.sent4: In the chronologies of nature, the changing seasons mark the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful visuals to teach us about the chronologies of World War II.

meanings.definition: A record of events in the order of their occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The family kept a detailed chronologies of all the important milestones.
meanings.sent2: The ancient scroll contained a fascinating chronologies of the kingdom's rise and fall.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled coffee on the chronologies, making it illegible.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a well-organized chronologies, never missing a single detail.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a timeline showcasing the chronologies of human evolution.
